lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Yilia_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Yilia.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Yilia.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
# Checks that all text files end with a newline.
# Preserve filename with spaces by only splitting on newlines.
print "ERROR", $1, $2, " prohibited \\r\\n line ending, use \\n instead."
# Only warn for markdown files (*.md) to accomodate text editors
# which do not properly handle trailing whitespace.
